title: Does HDMX table have new functions?
content:
I’ve heard somewhere that HDMX table in TTF fonts has some new functions (besides containing records about non linear glyphs widths). Does it mean that even if hinting didn’t touch any sidebearings (e.g. cleartype hinting), it is recommended that font should include HDMX table?

So if hinting moves some of the right sidebearings ( e.g. in B/W hinting) and I will not generate HDMX table, this font will not work correctly? Or is it that, the font WILL work correctly ( concerning spacing ) but will be slower, because it will need to recalculate all moved sidebearings?

Thanks for your time, peter

author: peter bilak

comments.content:
hi Peter, we are not aware of any changes, do you recall where you may have heard this?

mike

Mike, it was an informal chat with people who work professionally with hinting, and they said that they ALWAYS use HDMX table, even when they do not modify the sidebearing, because it has some other functions. Sorry i don’t know anything more, I’ve searched for it, found nothing, and that’s why I am asking here. But if you say that you don’t know about any changes, or reasons to use it when the sidebearings are not modified, that would also answer my question.

Peter
